title: What makes the Little League Classic so special?
content: Little Leaguers spending time with their favorite MLB stars, autographs and more. Here's what makes Williamsport so special.

title: Scheffler wins BMW, fifth PGA Tour crown of '25
content: Scottie Scheffler erased a four-shot deficit in five holes and then delivered a haymaker on the daunting par-3 17th by chipping in from 82 feet for birdie that carried him to victory Sunday in the BMW Championship for his fifth PGA Tour title of the year.

title: Reds turn tables in extras, snap Brewers' streak
content: The Reds snapped the Brewers' franchise-record 14-game winning streak by turning the tables on Milwaukee with a 3-2 win in the 10th inning.

title: Gabriel: 'Entertainers' remark not about Shedeur
content: Browns quarterback Dillon Gabriel clarified Saturday that a comment he made during an in-game interview wasn't meant as a dig at teammate Shedeur Sanders.

title: Sources: Eagles trade for Texans WR Metchie
content: The Houston Texans are trading wide receiver John Metchie III to the Philadelphia Eagles, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Fever rally for big win after Cunningham's injury
content: After Fever guard Sophie Cunningham suffered a knee injury in the second quarter, Indiana mounted the largest comeback in franchise history, erasing a 21-point deficit to beat the Sun 99-93 in overtime.

title: Packers RB Lloyd injured again, may miss opener
content: Oft-injured running back MarShawn Lloyd is at risk to miss the Packers' regular-season opener and beyond due to a hamstring injury he suffered in Saturday's preseason game.

title: Marlins' Myers heckled at Fenway before hitting HR
content: Marlins right fielder Dane Myers got into it with a fan at Fenway Park but did not want to get into details of what was said.

title: 'Proud and honored' Bird sees Storm unveil statue
content: In a ceremony before Seattle hosted the Phoenix Mercury on Sunday, legendary former Storm guard Sue Bird, who led the franchise to four WNBA championships, became the first WNBA player honored by her team with a statue outside of Climate Pledge Arena.

title: üèà Fantasy Football 2025: Ultimate Draft Board
content: Mike Clay provides his blueprint for 2025 fantasy football drafts, including ideal selections in each round and overall strategy.

title: Tory Horton, Jaxson Dart, Adonai Mitchell among deep sleepers for 2025
content: These sleepers are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who may emerge in 2025.

title: Inside the hidden costs of football: '88 Saints speak out
content: Nearly 40 years after their time in the NFL, the players from the 1988 New Orleans Saints grapple with the physical toll of football while honoring a bond forged through the toughest game.

title: Arsenal begin new season in style as problems persist for Man United
content: Arsenal open their Premier League campaign with a crucial 1-0 win at Manchester United, exposing the key differences between the two sides.

title: Venus Williams is back at the US Open -- eyeing one title not on her long list
content: Two-time former US Open champion Venus Williams will play again this week. And she still has one major career goal.

title: Zack Wheeler on IL with blood clot: What it means, what to expect
content: With Phillies ace Zack Wheeler on the IL with blood clots, what does that mean and how have other pitchers fared?

title: Bills backup Mitchell Trubisky reminisces on time in Chicago
content: Securing the QB2 job is the next step for Trubisky in hopes of reaching his ultimate, and difficult, goal to once again become a starter.

title: Preseason trade tracker: Every move leading up to the 2025 season
content: We are following every trade since the start of training camps, including the most recent buzz from every team.

title: Chimaev-Makhachev? Murphy-Volkanovski? Possibilities for UFC 319 winners
content: The summer's last pay-per-view event produced a new champion and chances for more fireworks to end 2025.

title: Bowl projections: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: üéµ Taylor Swift joins Kelce brothers on 'New Heights'
content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan -- and even caught Caitlin Clark's attention.

title: üìà NFL Future Power Rankings
content: We ranked all 32 NFL franchises' expectations for 2025 through 2027. Which teams are set up to thrive in the future?

title: üèà Predicting best, worst scenarios for NFL teams
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: üèÄ Is there any coming back for banned Knicks fans?
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: Is Flagg a ROY lock? How 11 rookies can challenge the No. 1 pick
content: NBA analyst Kevin Pelton groups 11 players most likely to threaten the Mavericks' No. 1 pick for the auspicious award.

title: Jon Rahm defends LIV points title but loses in playoff
content: Jon Rahm successfully defended his LIV Golf season points title but still lost in a playoff to Sebastian Munoz in the Indianapolis event.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to bring De Gea back?
content: Manchester United could bring goalkeeper David de Gea back to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 20 tourists left stranded by guide in Ranthambore tiger safari; probe ordered
content: Three canter drivers and the guide have been barred from entering the park till the probe is completed, Deputy Conservator of Forests (DCF) Pramod Dhakad said

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis, his Deputy CMs congratulate Radhakrishnan over V-P nomination
content: ‚ÄúRadhakrishnan‚Äôs selection as the Vice-Presidential candidate fills us all Maharashtrians with immense pride‚Äù says Maharashtra CM

title: IndiGo flight makes sudden ‚Äògo around‚Äô at Assam‚Äôs Guwahati airport
content: A go-around, also known as a missed approach or aborted landing, is a procedure where an aircraft, during its final approach or after touchdown, discontinues its landing attempt and climbs back into the air for another approach or diversion

title: Writers, activists condemn statements by Ministers and BJP¬†on Dharmasthala case
content: A group of senior writers and activists from the State, under the banner of Jagruta Nagareekaru - Karnataka, have condemned statements by multiple Ministers in the Congress government and the Bharatiya Janata Party regarding the ongoing probe into alleged burials at Dharmasthala

title: Two dead, over 300 injured in Dahi Handi festivities in Mumbai
content: The Dahi Handi festival, celebrated a day after Krishna Janmashtami, involves the formation of a human pyramid to break an earthen pot with curd in it

title: People of West Bengal want SIR, says State BJP chief
content: Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari has claimed that four categories of voters, including deceased voters and voters who are residents of Bangladesh, will be removed from the rolls

title: CJI B.R. Gavai inaugurates Bombay High Court circuit Bench at Kolhapur
content: At present, apart from the principal bench in Mumbai, the HC has two more benches ‚Äî at Nagpur in Vidarbha region and Aurangabad (Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar) in Marathwada region. A third bench of the High Court sits in adjoining Goa

title: INDIA bloc to hold talks on V-P candidate
content: A senior Congress leader told The Hindu that they will reach out to senior leaders of the opposition bloc over phone to arrive at a consensus candidate.

title: Lok Sabha to hold special discussion on the impact of Astronaut Shukla‚Äôs space mission
content: Opposition to take a call at the Monday morning meeting of the Opposition floor leaders on whether it will take part in the discussion or continue with its protests on SIR

title: File affidavit in seven days or apologise: ECI ultimatum on Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs Karnataka vote theft allegations
content: CEC Gyanesh Kumar refuses to provide machine-readable voter lists, CCTV footage of polling, citing voter privacy concerns; says if complaints are not filed within 45 days of poll results, parties must file affidavits

title: Lahar Singh petitions ECI on audio clip in which a Congress MLA allegedly speaks on cash distribution to voters
content: BJP Rajya Sabha member Lahar Singh Siroya has urged the Election Commission of India (ECI) to investigate an audio clip allegedly featuring Congress MLA for Arsikere K.M. Shivalinge Gowda discussing cash distribution for¬†voters during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls ¬†

title: Temple authorities in Karnataka directed to impose fines on those using plastic items, says Minister
content: With the State government banning the use of plastic on the premises of temples coming under the Hindu Religious Institutions and Charitable Endowments Department from August 15, a plastic ban awareness programme was organised by the department

title: New GST regime will be consumer-centric, says Centre
content: The new two-tier Goods and Services Tax (GST) structure of 18% and 5% rates will have the twin objective of making rates and processes simpler and more rational, as it was originally intended to be, say senior government sources

title: Disturbing that PM did not mention Nehru in I-Day speech: Sharad Pawar
content: NCP(SP) chief says 300 Opposition MPs united in peaceful protest for first time against ECI; recalls how Maharashtra Congress had once prioritised unity for ideological reasons in post-Emergency era

title: Protesting teachers plotting to incite violence during rally: West Bengal police
content: Deputy Commissioner of Police, Bidhannagar Anish Sarkar released an audio conversation between two persons who were allegedly making plans to incite violence during the march on Monday

title: Former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik admitted to hospital
content: According to BJD, the  Leader of the Opposition is suffering from dehydration and will be discharged soon

title: Seven women and children among eight charred to death in car-SUV collision
content: The horrific accident occurred on a highway near Dedadara village in Wadhwan taluka at around 3:40 p.m. when the car was headed towards Surendranagar city from Kadu village.

title: Inaccuracies flagged in Class IV textbook
content: Errors found in Environmental Science textbook. SCERT says mistakes found after printing are immediately corrected on the website. However, corrections have been made only on the Malayalam version

title: State seeks additional supply of urea coming in 4 ships by month-end to overcome 2.69L tonnes short supply
content: Minister for Agriculture Tummala Nageswara Rao says problems in functioning of RFCL Ramagudam also added to urea scarcity

title: INDIA Bloc Leaders Likely To Discuss Joint Veep Candidate Today
content: The opposition INDIA bloc leaders are likely to discuss their joint candidate for the post of vice-president at a meeting of floor leaders on Monday morning.

title: Student Found Dead In Hostel Of BITS Pilani Goa Campus; Cops Launch Probe
content: A 20-year-old student of the BITS Pilani campus in Goa has been found dead in his hostel room, police said on Sunday.

title: British Actor Terence Stamp, Who Played General Zod In Early Superman Films, Dies At 87
content: Terence Stamp, the British actor who often played the role of a complex villain, including that of General Zod in the early Superman films, has died. He was 87.

title: Government Orders Closure Of Educational Institutes Jammu Today Due To Bad Weather
content: The Jammu and Kashmir government on Sunday ordered the closure of all educational institutions in the Jammu region on Monday in view of the inclement weather conditions, officials said.

title: US States Rethink Practice Of Setting Speed Limits Based On How Fast Drivers Travel
content: Rose Hammond pushed authorities for years to lower the 55 mph speed limit on a two-lane road that passes her assisted living community, a church, two schools and a busy park that hosts numerous youth sports leagues.

title: Air India Cancels Milan-Delhi Flight Due To Maintenance Issue
content: Tata Group-owned private carrier Air India on Sunday said it cancelled its Milan-Delhi flight of August 16 after detecting a maintenance issue at the last minute.

title: Out-Of-Balance Gut Bacteria Connected To Multiple Sclerosis: Study
content: Multiple sclerosis is a disease that results when the immune system mistakenly attacks the brain and spinal cord. It affects nearly one million people in the US and over 2.8 million worldwide.

title: Mumbai Man 'Fires' From Air Gun After Argument Over Late Delivery Of Medicine
content: A 35-year-old employee of a bank was booked for attempt to murder after he pulled the trigger of an air gun following an argument with a person over the delayed delivery of medicines at his flat in Mumbai, police said on Sunday.

title: GPS Disruption After Israel-Iran Conflict Makes Tehran's Roads Chaotic
content: The streets of Tehran have become a confusing maze for driver Farshad Fooladi amid widespread GPS disruption, still ongoing nearly two months after the end of Iran and Israel's unprecedented 12-day war.

title: Names Of 65 lakh Voters Excluded In Bihar Draft Roll Posted On District Websites: Election Body
content: The list of names deleted from Bihar's draft electoral rolls following special intensive revision has been posted on the websites of district magistrates following the Supreme Court's orders, Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar said on Sunday.

title: BJP's Veep Pick Will Cause Cracks In Opposition Bloc? It Depends On...
content: With Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan named as the National Democratic Alliance's candidate for Vice President, the BJP has made a calculated move that blends hard electoral arithmetic with a deeper regional strategy.

title: "RSS Was Against Independence, Women's Voter Rights": Mallikarjun Kharge
content: PM Modi's effusive praise of the RSS, the BJP's parent body, in his Independence Day speech drew strong criticism from Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, who, on Sunday, claimed that the outfit had been "opposed" to freedom from the British

title: "Naming Tamilian Not Pro-Tamil Nadu": MK Stalin's Party On BJP's Veep Pick
content: The NDA naming a Tamilian, CP Radhakrishnan, as Vice Presidential candidate is "not pro-Tamil Nadu", said DMK's TKS Elangovan today.

title: Vice President Pick CP Radhakrishnan's Mother Recalls The Story Behind Son's Name
content: It was a deeply personal moment turning political in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur district on Saturday, as Janaki Ammal, mother of Vice-Presidential candidate C P Radhakrishnan, cut a celebratory cake at home.

title: Maharashtra Official's Singing Video At Work Goes Viral, Gets Suspended
content: A tehsildar from Maharashtra has been suspended after he was filmed singing a Bollywood song while seated in his official chair at his send-off function following transfer, officials said on Sunday.

title: "Said It Before PM Modi": Rahul Gandhi Jabs At BJP Over Caste Census
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Sunday claimed that the Modi government announced a caste census only under pressure and it would neither get a "true" caste census done nor remove the 50 per cent cap on reservations.

title: Rajasthan Tiger Safari Horror: Guide Leaves Tourists In The Middle Of Jungle
content: In a shocking case of alleged negligence at Rajasthan's Ranthambore National Park, a group of tourists were left stranded in the park's zone 6 for nearly 90 minutes in a forest full of tigers after their safari canter broke down.

title: Why Several Voters' Homes Listed As "House Number 0"? Poll Body Clarifies
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar on Sunday said instances of a person holding multiple voter identity cards arise due to migration or administrative lapses and the poll authority is working to rectify such mistakes.

title: Man's Body Found Rotting In A Drum In Rajasthan, Wife And Children Missing
content: A man's rotting body has been recovered from a drum on the first floor of his rented home in Rajasthan's Alwar, said the police Sunday.

title: Black Mayors Slam Trump, Highlight Sharp Crime Drop In Cities
content: As President Donald Trump declared Washington, DC, a crime-ridden wasteland in need of federal intervention this week and threatened similar federal interventions in other Black-led cities, several mayors compared notes.

title: Demand to introduce MEMU service, augment coaches in trains in Ernakulam-Thrissur corridor
content: Passengers say traffic snarls on the stretch could continue for another 10 months until the works to decongest bottlenecked junctions on NH 544 are complete

title: Tamil Nadu prepares the ground to grab a major share in semiconductor landscape
content: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs Semiconductor Design Promotion Scheme, which part of its ‚Çπ500-crore¬†Tamil Nadu Semiconductor Mission 2030, is  aimed at turbocharging the State‚Äôs¬†fabless¬†design ecosystem by offering targeted subsidies and prototyping grants

title: Low FMGE pass percentage: medical aspirants cautious about foreign varsities
content: Georgia, Uzbekistan, Kazakhstan, and Kyrgyzstan new favourites as war situation takes the sheen out of Ukraine and Russia

title: Five held for slaughtering cattle in Nelamangala
content: Police registered a case against unknown persons charging them under Karnataka Prevention of Cow Slaughter and Preservation of Cattle Act, 2020

title: Hemachandran murder: one more suspect nabbed from Wayanad
content: The man, identified as Melbin Mathew, was nabbed for his alleged role in covering the planned abduction and murder

title: Constitutional validity does not mean desirability, ex-CJI Khanna tells one nation, one election panel
content: Justice Sanjiv Khanna has joined a few other former CJIs in raising concerns over the extent of power given to the Election Commission in the Bill

title: Leak of complaint submitted to CPI(M) Polit Bureau triggers political controversy
content: Satheesan demands clarification from party and government on the veracity of the accusations in the complaint

title: BJP leaders to be questioned regarding Suresh Gopi‚Äôs suspected leopard tooth pendant
content: Congress worker shares video clips of the Minister walking along the Swaraj Round wearing the suspected wildlife trophy, identifies one of the accompanying persons as Thrissur BJP president. He terms the other person identifiable

title: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby slams Naidu‚Äôs silence on resettlement of Polavaram-displaced ¬†
content: MPs elected from Andhra Pradesh since 2014 are to be blamed for failing to raise their voice for Polavaram R&R, says Mr. Baby

title: New projects on the Godavari justifiable only after share of surplus waters is decided, says Telangana Deputy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka
content: The share of surplus waters can be decided only after the ongoing projects are completed and water allocations made, he says

title: 185 people crossed a line
content: Last month, when Pakistani nationals in Gujarat got Indian citizenship under the CAA, they rejoiced. Escaping alleged persecution and insecurity, many have waited for over a decade for this having come over the border on tourist visas. Abhinay Deshpande reports on their relief, the struggle behind the paperwork and their children‚Äôs prospects

title: Kerala showcases a secular cultural alternative to the world, says Minister K. Rajan
content: International Literary Festival opens in Thrissur; Kerala Sahitya Akademi auditorium named after writer M.T. Vasudevan Nair¬†

title: Maharashtra Governor, former Coimbatore MP C.P. Radhakrishnan is NDA‚Äôs vice-presidential pick
content: A two-time former MP from T.N., Radhakrishnan is known for his ability to reach across party lines; he had also headed the State BJP unit; PM says the Maharashtra Governor has distinguished himself with his ‚Äòdedication, humility and intellect‚Äô

title: Kuttanad cannot be treated as a political laboratory: Archbishop
content: He questions the apathy of governments towards the problems of Kuttanad residents, who face daily hardships due to waterlogging for last four months and the resulting crisis in the agricultural sector.

title: Villagers cautioned as flood level rises in Godavari
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi directs officials to be on high alert, while a control room has been opened at Eluru Collectorate; MP Putta Mahesh Kumar asks officers to evacuate villagers from low-lying areas

title: SIT officials will decide on whether to continue with probe, says Home Minister
content: Seeking that the alleged mass burial issue in Dharmasthala should not be politicised, Home Minister G. Parameshwara has said that Special Investigation Team officials will decide on whether to continue the probe or not¬†

title: Siddaramaiah is behind conspiracy against Dharmasthala, says Ashok
content: Urban Naxals are spreading slander against the holy place, according to Leader of Opposition in the Assembly

title: Board of Governors of Digital University Kerala to meet on Monday
content: First-ever meeting of BoG in over three months. Reappointment of  Ciza Thomas as interim Vice-Chancellor has paved the way for the meeting

title: Bill to decriminalise minor offences to be introduced in the Lok Sabha on Monday
content: Over 350 provisions are proposed to be amended through the Bill; the legislation is part of the government‚Äôs effort to improve the country‚Äôs business climate

title: Andhra Pradesh likely to see a 20-cm rise in sea level by 2050 due to global warming
content: The Draft State Action Plan on Climate Change assesses that the rise in sea level will be approximately 0.20 metres in 25 years along Nellore, Guntur and West Godavari; it also estimates that 35,000 hectares of prime agricultural land in coastal Andhra Pradesh will become saline

title: Oppn show of strength in Bihar as allies join Rahul's 'Vote Adhikar Yatra'
content: India bloc launched 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Sasaram, Bihar, led by Rahul Gandhi, protesting against alleged electoral roll discrepancies and "vote theft." The event showcased the unity of the 'mahagathbandhan' with RJD, CPM, CPI(M-L) Liberation, CPI, and VIP leaders joining Congress. Lalu Prasad's fiery speech and Tejashwi's warning to central leaders highlighted the rally.

title: Exports to US likely saw 7x faster growth vs overall rise
content: Indian exports to the US surged by 21% due to frontloading in anticipation of Trump's tariffs, overshadowing overall export growth. While exporters are offering discounts to retain business amidst uncertainty, concerns remain about sustaining operations if tariffs reach 50%. Industry leaders are seeking government support to mitigate potential job losses, particularly in the MSME sector.

title: Give affidavit within 7 days or apologise: CEC to Rahul
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar has challenged Rahul Gandhi to substantiate his claims of electoral roll irregularities and 'vote theft' within seven days, demanding either sworn proof or a public apology. Kumar refuted the allegations, citing transparent electoral processes and endorsements from party representatives.

title: Rahul hits back at EC, says it's helping BJP steal votes
content: Rahul Gandhi, during the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, accused the Election Commission of colluding with the BJP in "vote theft." He alleged a 2023 law shields election commissioners from legal action, enabling the EC to favor the ruling party.

title: President, not SC, decides when to seek court's opinion: Centre
content: The Union government has strongly objected to a recent court judgment that mandates the President to seek the Supreme Court's opinion on the constitutionality of bills. Arguing against the directive, the Centre asserts that the judiciary cannot dictate how the President exercises her discretionary powers under Article 143.

title: It's time to buy India, not sell, says Jefferies' Wood
content: Jefferies' Christopher Wood advises investors to buy Indian equities, anticipating Trump will back down from tariff threats, which are not in America's interest. Wood highlights India's recent underperformance and high valuations but notes its tendency to rebound after such periods.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance
content: Microsoft is mandating a return to office for employees near its Redmond headquarters, requiring at least three days a week in-person starting January 2025. This shift aligns Microsoft with other tech giants like Amazon, Google and Meta, tightening remote work policies.

title: Trump tariff: Banks look to contain impact
content: Indian banks are proactively cushioning exporters from the impact of the US tariff hike, effective August 27. Measures include temporary interest concessions, flexible repayment options, and enhanced working capital. Indian Bank is considering fee waivers and tailored support for MSMEs in key export hubs. Other banks like IOB are advising on market diversification and hedging strategies.

title: Uttarakhand to repeal madrassa Act, new law to cover all minority institutions
content: Uttarakhand's cabinet approved the Uttarakhand Minority Educational Institutions Bill, 2025, extending minority status benefits to Sikh, Jain, Christian, Buddhist, and Parsi educational institutions, a first in the country. This legislation, set to be introduced in August, will replace existing Madrassa education laws and establish the Uttarakhand State Minority Education Authority to oversee education quality and ensure equal opportunities.

title: Putin‚Äôs price for peace ‚Äî and what Russia promises in return to Ukraine
content: Vladimir Putin has indicated a willingness to end the war in Ukraine, proposing terms that require Kyiv to cede significant territory and acknowledge Russia's claim over Crimea. Donald Trump described the meeting as productive, signaling agreement on a peace framework. However, Volodymyr Zelenskyy rejects territorial concessions, seeking security guarantees ahead of planned talks with Trump, creating unease among European leaders.

title: Apple's H-1B pay breakdown: How much iPhone maker pays engineers, designers & more
content: Apple, a tech giant with a market capitalization exceeding $3 trillion, is actively recruiting for numerous AI and machine learning positions. According to a federal filing, these roles offer substantial base salaries, with some positions reaching up to $468,500 for human interface designers. CEO Tim Cook emphasizes the company's commitment to hiring diverse talent and fostering a collaborative environment.

title: Naveen Patnaik hospitalised for dehydration
content: Former Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik was hospitalized Sunday evening due to dehydration. Doctors report his condition as stable and that he is responding positively to treatment. Current Chief Minister Mohan Charan Majhi has expressed his concern and offered prayers for Patnaik's swift recovery and good health.

title: SC takes up problems of cadets incurring disabilities during training
content: The Supreme Court has initiated a case, "In Re: Cadets Disabled During Military Training Struggle," addressing the hardships faced by military cadets who acquire disabilities during training. These cadets, often from prestigious institutions, are medically discharged before commissioning. Consequently, they are denied ex-servicemen benefits such as disability pensions and healthcare, leaving them without institutional support.

title: ‚Äò82% stake sold‚Äô: Tesla exec offloads shares; Musk renews short seller threat
content: Tesla's Tom Zhu has sold over 82% of his Tesla shares since 2023. The sales occurred between 2023 and 2024. Elon Musk warned short sellers of potential losses if Tesla achieves full autonomy. Musk has clashed with Bill Gates over Gates' alleged short position against Tesla. This position reportedly cost Gates $1.5 billion.

title: Wang Yi to meet PM on Tuesday ahead of Modi's China visit
content: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi is set to meet PM Modi on Tuesday before Modi's China visit for the SCO summit in Tianjin. Wang's three-day visit includes talks with S Jaishankar and Ajit Doval, focusing on the boundary question. The meeting with Modi will cover the SCO summit agenda and Sino-India ties.

title: LeBron's wife Savannah James reveals their love story might have ended
content: Savannah James, wife of NBA star LeBron James, revealed in a podcast episode that their relationship might not have survived if LeBron hadn't been drafted by the Cleveland Cavaliers. She expressed uncertainty about their future had he not stayed close to home. Despite early challenges, including a teenage pregnancy, the couple persevered and married in 2013.

title: From Nehru's kinship to Modi's firepower: India shifts tone on Pak
content: India's approach to Pakistan has undergone a significant transformation, shifting from Nehru's emphasis on kinship and reconciliation to Modi's assertive stance of deterrence and retaliation. Modi's recent Independence Day address signaled a departure from past policies, prioritizing national interests and farmers' rights over conciliatory sentiment.

title: 3-time NBA champ honors Magic Johnson with heartfelt 66th birthday tribute
content: Magic Johnson celebrated his 66th birthday on August 14, 2025, receiving heartfelt tributes, notably from former Lakers teammate Byron Scott. Scott's message emphasized their enduring bond, forged during the Showtime era, highlighting their shared victories and mutual respect. The celebration extended beyond basketball achievements, underscoring Johnson's leadership, mentorship, and lasting friendships.

title: Mahomes skips Kelce to hit Xavier Worthy on 40-yard strike at camp
content: Patrick Mahomes is seemingly evolving his offensive strategy, potentially shifting from relying heavily on Travis Kelce to incorporating rookie Xavier Worthy and other receivers. Mahomes' increased intensity and focus on mechanics during training camp signal a new chapter for the Chiefs' offense. He aims for a more balanced and explosive attack, showcasing sharper passes and deeper reads.

title: Gisele B√ºndchen made a drastic move amid Tom Brady drama to save marriage
content: In 2015, Tom Brady and Gisele B√ºndchen faced immense strain during the "Deflategate" scandal, pushing their relationship to a breaking point. The intense scrutiny and pressure led to communication breakdown and escalating tensions. Seeking professional help, the couple used counseling to navigate the crisis, ultimately strengthening their bond and weathering the storm together.

title: 4 Indian-origin men held over armed attack in England
content: In Bilston, near Wolverhampton, a violent armed assault led to the arrest of four Indian-origin men: Hardeep Singh, Harpeet Singh, Mukesh Kumar, and Lakwinder Singh. The incident, involving bladed weapons, left three men seriously wounded and a car heavily damaged. Police investigations are ongoing after responding to reports of a fight, with authorities believing it to be a targeted attack.

title: Brittany Mahomes takes action to prevent every parent‚Äôs worst nightmare
content: Brittany Mahomes, drawing from her family's frightening experience with her son's nut allergy, is advocating for enhanced food allergy awareness and safety. Partnering with organizations like Kal√©o and FARE, she's sharing vital information and practical steps for schools and families. Mahomes emphasizes preparedness and education, highlighting the importance of recognizing symptoms and fostering inclusive environments to protect allergic children.

title: 'Excited to ...': Pak head coach on Asia Cup squad minus Babar, Rizwan
content: Pakistan have announced its squad for the Asia Cup T20 and a preceding tri-series, surprisingly omitting Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Coach Mike Hesson aims to broaden the player pool, blending youth with experience. Salman Ali Agha will lead the team, featuring Shaheen Shah Afridi in a strong bowling unit.

title: Teacher‚Äôs delay saves 80 children in cloudburst-hit J&K village
content: In a remote village of Chasoti, teacher Hukum Chand's decision to delay his students' lunch saved 80 children from a catastrophic flash flood. As a mountain collapsed into a stream, destroying homes and temples, Chand's quick thinking ensured the children's safety while the rest of the village was left grappling with immense loss and devastation.

title: AIIMS Jammu secures 7th rank in govt medical universities rankings
content: AIIMS Jammu has achieved 7th position nationwide in the Government Medical Universities Ranking 2025, becoming the second-highest ranked institute after AIIMS Delhi. The institute scored 385.62 out of 400 in Academic and Research Excellence, reflecting its quality teaching and research. This success is attributed to the Pradhan Mantri Swasthya Suraksha Yojana.

title: Days after Kishtwar rain fury, Kathua cloudburst leaves 7 dead
content: Tragedy struck Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua district as flash floods and landslides, triggered by a cloudburst and heavy rain, claimed at least seven lives, including five children. The deluge submerged villages, damaged houses and disrupted transportation, prompting rescue operations by the Army, police, and SDRF. Authorities have issued warnings and closed schools as more rain is expected in the region.

title: SDRF man gets adoption calls for 13-month-old girl saved from Kishtwar rubble
content: Shahnawaz, an SDRF member, became a hero after rescuing a 13-month-old girl from debris in Kishtwar. A cloudburst caused flash floods, resulting in deaths and injuries. Shahnawaz's photo went viral. He also revived another girl. Despite the dangers, his family supports his work. He continues to warn people about the stream.

title: 'Putin unable to take Donetsk': Zelenskyy before Trump talks; 'need US on our side'
content: President Zelenskyy advocated against ceding territories to Russia ahead of talks with President Trump, emphasizing that territorial discussions require Ukraine's presence in a trilateral format. He stressed the need for a ceasefire and real negotiations along the current front line, seeking united Western backing.

title: India's squad for Asia Cup: Who from 'Class of 2023' still remain in the mix
content: Indian selectors are set to announce the squad for the Asia Cup 2025, a T20I event in the UAE. With key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli retired, opportunities arise for youngsters. Suryakumar Yadav, Hardik Pandya, and Jasprit Bumrah are expected to lead, while competition intensifies with the emergence of talents like Yashasvi Jaiswal.

title: Ayesha Curry shares baby Cai moment: walks in Steph‚Äôs footsteps
content: Ayesha Curry shared heartwarming moments on Instagram, showcasing baby Cai following in Stephen Curry's basketball footsteps. The post featured Cai enthusiastically dunking a ball, capturing the attention of fans. Amidst Stephen's Curry Camp, Ayesha keeps fans updated on their family life, including celebrating their 14th wedding anniversary with a touching message for her husband.

title: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin: Peace talks collapse amid tensions
content: Tennis legend Martina Navratilova called Donald Trump a 'beaten man'. This comment came after the U.S. President's meeting with Vladimir Putin in Alaska. The meeting failed to produce a peace deal for Ukraine. Trump left reporters without answers. European leaders want Ukraine to be part of any peace talks. Volodymyr Zelenskyy rejected a proposal involving ceding territory.

title: 'Stop calling them key players': Hafeez slams Babar, Rizwan after squad snub
content: Mohammad Hafeez ignited debate by stating Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan are no longer Pakistan's 'key players' due to inconsistent match-winning performances. He highlighted Salman Ali Agha, Saeem Ayub, and Hasan Nawaz as current impactful players.

title: Asia Cup: Gill, Jaiswal or Samson? Ashwin highlights India‚Äôs selection dilemma
content: As Indian selectors gear up to announce the Asia Cup 2025 squad, Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted key selection dilemmas. With the tournament serving as a T20 World Cup preparation ground, the opening slot is a major talking point. Ashwin questioned whether Shubman Gill fits into the T20 plans, considering Yashasvi Jaiswal's prior role.

title: 'Class isn‚Äôt his strength': Ex-Pak cricketer backs Pathan after 'badtameez' jibe at Afridi
content: Danish Kaneria has supported Irfan Pathan's revelations about his rivalry with Shahid Afridi, criticising Afridi for resorting to personal attacks. Pathan recounted instances where Afridi mocked his identity, fueling his determination to dismiss him on the field. Kaneria echoed Pathan's claims, stating Afridi often targets individuals' families or religion, lacking class and decency.

title: Who is CP Radhakrishnan? Meet NDA candidate for VP polls
content: CP Radhakrishnan, the Maharashtra governor with a strong BJP background and RSS roots, has been nominated as the NDA's candidate for the upcoming Vice Presidential election, following Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation. Radhakrishnan, a two-time Lok Sabha MP and former state BJP president, brings extensive experience in politics and governance to the role.

title: ‚ÄòMountain came down‚Äô: In Kishtwar, a desperate hunt for survivors amid rubble
content: A devastating cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district triggered flash floods, obliterating Chasoti village. At least 60 lives were lost, with scores injured and dozens still missing. Piyra Singh, a survivor, recounted the horror as his home collapsed, claiming the lives of his relatives. Rescue operations are underway as families grapple with immense grief.

title: From 'vote chori' to CCTV to house no. zero: How EC countered oppn allegations
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar addressed opposition claims of electoral roll manipulation in Bihar, emphasizing the Election Commission's impartiality. He highlighted the collaborative and transparent nature of the Special Intensive Revision process, involving voters and party representatives.

title: Jam Miller injury confirmed by Kalen DeBoer; return timeline unclear
content: Alabama Crimson Tide's senior running back, Jam Miller, suffered an upper-body injury during a scrimmage, requiring a medical procedure. Coach Kalen DeBoer anticipates Miller's full recovery, though his return date remains uncertain. In Miller's absence, Richard Young, Daniel Hill, and Dre Washington are expected to step up. Miller's absence could impact the season opener against Florida State on August 30.

title: Viral video: Kohli, wife Anushka enjoy London stroll; duo seen interacting with locals
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were recently spotted enjoying a leisurely walk in London, interacting warmly with locals. This break precedes Kohli's preparations for the significant Australia series in October. Meanwhile, Kohli celebrated India's thrilling 6-run victory against England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, praising Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performance and dedication. Kohli has always acknowledged Siraj's evolution as a bowler.

title: ‚õ≥ Augusta National ditches masses for revenue

title: NFL preseason Week 2 takeaways: Is Saints' QB job Spencer Rattler's to lose?
content: the second week of the 2025 preseason kicks off on friday . quarterback Trevor Lawrence throws a 7-yard pass to Parker Washington for an early Jaguars touchdown . the first-team offense was nearly perfect -- 7 first downs, 108 yards and 4.6 yards per carry .
